div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 668 Cisnadie (formerly Heltau), c. 8 km. 484) S of Sibiu, Rumania, 1836 Burial: after 48 B.C. (T) Contents: c. 500 AE. Pot hoard Corcyra: 498 (incl. ΖΕϒC ΚΑCΙΟC issue) Pharos, Illyria: 2 * Panormus (?): 2 Disposition: dispersed † Ackner, AVSL 4 (1851), pp. 19-21 Mitrea, ED 10 (1945), p. 89, no. 22 * These are described as having a helmeted Athena hd./IIA and forepart of a galley. Are they poorly-preserved coins of an Illyrian mint, perhaps Dyrrha- chium?
